value.title: DAX Fridays! #148: CONVERT and resolve variant data-type error
value.excerpt: Have you got this error in Power BI? "Expressions that yield variant data-type cannot be used to define calculated columns". If you have, check this video to learn how to fix it using the new DAX function CONVERT.  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays

value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SWITCH in DAX/ Powerpivot. Switch is the equivalent of IF but it has easier syntax and therefore it is easier to read. value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. In this video, I show you how it works.  Link to DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.codeplex.com/  Link to YTD video and Power BI file: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5WGOTsYngCI

value.title: DAX FRIDAYS! #178 : My age calculations in DAX and Power Query are wrong!! How do I do it?
value.excerpt: Calculating age is harder that you think, both in power query and dax.  In today's video, I am going to show you two ways to do it with DAX  and power query that get the closest to the actual age.  Do you know any other method to calculate age? Share it in the comments!  Link to previous power query

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?
